abstracts.cdata!:
This is a project completion report of
            the Guayape Regional Development Project in Honduras. This
            project was the fourth agricultural project financed by the
            Bank in Honduras. The project included agricultural credit
            and production support in the form of agricultural
            machinery, feeder roads, extension, and research services.
            The objectives of the project were to: (a) improve incomes
            of individual's mall-farmers and agrarian reform
            groups; and (b) accelerate growth of agricultural
            production. The main lessons to be learned are that: the
            project's informal marketing program, not anticipated
            at appraisal, proved also to be a good tool to assist
            project beneficiaries to sell their grains and to obtain
            better farm gate prices. It also helped to obtain better sub
            loan recovery rates; and the Bank appears to have been too
            flexible concerning submission of audit reports.

abstracts.cdata!:
This is a project completion report of
            the Guayape Regional Development Project in Honduras. This
            project was the fourth agricultural project financed by the
            Bank in Honduras. The project included agricultural credit
            and production support in the form of agricultural
            machinery, feeder roads, extension, and research services.
            The objectives of the project were to: (a) improve incomes
            of individual's mall-farmers and agrarian reform
            groups; and (b) accelerate growth of agricultural
            production. The main lessons to be learned are that: the
            project's informal marketing program, not anticipated
            at appraisal, proved also to be a good tool to assist

0.cdata!:
Honduras - Proyecto de Desarrollo
            Regional de Guayape

abstracts.cdata!:
The project would be the first phase of
            a Guayape River Watershed scheme for development of the
            entire Valley. The objective of this first phase is to
            provide an integrated package of assistance and services for
            about 1,200 small farmers and 70 agrarian reform settlements
            with over 1,500 families in selected areas of the Valley.
            This package will include investment and production credit,
            extension services, machinery pool services, small scale
            irrigation schemes for some settlements, rural road
            improvement, and improved research facilities. The project
            will include technical assistance and training for the
            project unit and preparation of an agricultural project for
            possible future Bank lending. The risks associated with the
            project are possible lack of farmer acceptance of the
            technological packages, and weak institutional support
            because of scarcity of qualified personnel and poor
            coordination between responsible agencies. In order to deal
            with these potential problems, a modest sized project has
            been designed with a project unit which will have adequate
            staff and authority to carry out the project, and the
            technology to be utilized will be based on the traditional
            pattern of farming activities in the project area.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Guayape Regional Development Project
            for Honduras will be the first phase of a Guayape River
            Watershed scheme for development of the entire Valley. The
            objective of this first phase is to provide an integrated
            package of assistance and services for about 1,200 small
            farmers and 70 agrarian reform settlements with over 1,500
            families in selected areas of the Valley. This package will
            include investment and production credit, extension
            services, machinery pool services, small scale irrigation
            schemes for some settlements, rural road improvement, and
            improved research facilities. The project will include
            technical assistance and training for the project unit and
            preparation of an agricultural project for possible future
            Bank lending. The risks associated with the project are
            possible lack of farmer acceptance of the technological
            packages, and weak institutional support because of scarcity
            of qualified personnel and poor coordination between
            responsible agencies. In order to deal with these potential
            problems, a modest sized project has been designed with a
            project unit which will have adequate staff and authority to
            carry out the project, and the technology to be utilized
            will be based on the traditional pattern of farming
            activities in the project area.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Guayape Regional Development Project
            for Honduras will be the first phase of a Guayape River
            Watershed scheme for development of the entire Valley. The
            objective of this first phase is to provide an integrated
            package of assistance and services for about 1,200 small
